case_vignette: A 16-year-old male with past medical history of severe nodulocystic acne presents to the emergency room with increasing painful cysts on the trunk after recently starting oral isotretinoin in the past 3 weeks! Patient endorses fevers, chills, joint pain particularly along the chest! Examination reveals multiple inflammatory papules and large cystic nodules wih hemorrhagic crust on the chest, shoulders, and back! The sternum is tender to palpation!
question: What is the final diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Ask different questions to cover more information. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have increasing painful cysts on my trunk, fevers, chills, and joint pain along my chest.
How long have you been experiencing these symptoms?
I've been experiencing these symptoms for the past 3 weeks.
Do you have any existing medical conditions or are you taking any medications currently?
Yes, I have severe nodulocystic acne and recently started taking oral isotretinoin.
Do any of your family members have similar symptoms, or a history of skin infections or autoimmune diseases?
I don't have information on that.
Have these symptoms appeared after you started your medication?
Yes, the symptoms started after I began the medication.
Final Diagnosis: Isotretinoin-induced systemic symptoms
